text:
Like java and java we need to have jarArg or Arg tag as part of jar task. This 
would enable the us to use some special tags of java jar command. such as -m 
etc. And also it would be nice to say which is the jar command executable path. 
so that if one write a new version of jar they it would be easy to plugin.

The similar story would apply to zip and war too..

Hope this makes sense to be looked as a new feature

<jar> doesnt exec jar. It uses org.apache.tools.zip.* to create zip files. 

If you want a manifest, use the manifest facility. If you don't want a manifest,
use <zip>. What other options were you thinking of?
